Intervention.evidence: compares the efficacy and safety of palonosetron and ondansetron

Objective.evidence: To establish evidence for best clinical practices, this meta-analysis compares the efficacy and safety of palonosetron and ondansetron in preventing PONV

Method_Outcome.evidence: reported the efficacy (nausea and vomiting) at postoperative time points, namely T1 (0–2 hours), T2 (0–6 hours), T3 (12–24 hours), T4 (24–48 hours), and T5 (24–72 hours)

Number_Randomised.evidence: Nineteen randomised controlled trials were included

Result_Outcome.evidence: Pooled risk ratio (RR) revealed that patients receiving palonosetron were significantly less likely to develop nausea [0–2 h, RR = 0.82 (95% confidence interval (CI): 0.50, 1.34)

Harms.evidence: The safety profiles of palonosetron and ondansetron were comparable
